text.author: Chris Tryhorn
text.description: A consortium including Silvio Berlusconi is poised to buy Big Brother producer Endemol this week in a £2bn deal. By Chris Tryhorn.
text.tags: Independent production companies,Business,Media business,Media,Television industry,Silvio Berlusconi,Endemol
text.title: Berlusconi group 'to buy Big Brother producer Endemol'

main.p: The £2bn sale of Big Brother producer Endemol is set to be completed this week amid reports that the company will be snapped up by a consortium including former Italian prime minister Silvio Berlusconi and the group's co-founder John de Mol.
Mr Berlusconi's media group, Mediaset, and Mr de Mol, who co-founded Endemol in 1994 before selling it to Spanish telecoms group Telefonica six years later, are being backed by Goldman Sachs.

The Berlusconi/de Mol consortium's £2bn bid has beaten off rival offers fronted by Endemol's former chief operating officer, Tom Barnicoat, and the managing director of Endemol France, Stephane Courbit, according to today's Financial Times.
Endemol was put up for sale by Telefonica in March, more than a year after the Spanish group had floated a 25% stake on the Dutch stock exchange.
The company's range of hit formats, which include Big Brother and Deal or No Deal, also attracted the interest of private equity companies.
Mr Barnicoat's bid was reportedly backed by Apax Partners and US group Thomas H Lee, while a French private equity player, PAI, supported Mr Courbit.
